instructions: Boil the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
In a pan, sauté the finely chopped onion and crushed garlic until soft.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Simmer the sauce for 20-30 minutes, cooking until thickened.
Serve with the boiled spaghetti, sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese.
Enjoy your Spaghetti Bolognese!
servingSuggestion: You can serve Spaghetti Bolognese with garlic bread or a green salad.

ingredients: Half a teaspoon of black pepper
instructions: Peel the eggplants in stripes and halve them, then fry.
Chop the onion and peppers, dice the tomatoes into small cubes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a pan, add the chopped onion and sauté until pink.
Add the ground beef and continue to sauté.
Add the peppers and tomatoes, add the tomato paste and mix.
Add salt and pepper, add a little water and cook the filling.
Fill the fried eggplants with the filling and arrange them on a tray.
Add water and bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees for 20 minutes.
servingSuggestion: Karnıyarık can be served with rice and cacık (tzatziki).

ingredients: Half a teaspoon of black pepper
instructions: Dice the eggplants and soak them in salt water.
Chop the peppers, grate the tomatoes.
Wash and dry the eggplants and fry them.
Heat the olive oil in a pan, sauté the chopped peppers.
Add the grated tomatoes and cook.
Add the fried eggplants, add salt and pepper.
Mix the mixture and transfer it to a serving plate.
servingSuggestion: Şakşuka can be served with yogurt on top.

instructions: Take the bulgur in a deep bowl and add hot water, then close the lid.
Finely chop the onions, parsley, cucumber, and tomatoes.
Mix the swollen bulgur and add the chopped ingredients.
Add olive oil, pomegranate molasses, salt, and pepper and mix well.
Transfer to a serving plate and serve cold.
servingSuggestion: Kısır can be served with lettuce leaves.
Serve warm in mugs, garnished with cinnamon sticks.
instructions: Combine apple cider, orange slices, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and star anise in a large pot.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat and let it simmer for at least 20 minutes.
Strain the cider to remove spices and orange slices.
Serve warm.
